feedback:
Excellent application of the DRIVER framework throughout your work. You clearly demonstrated 6 stages: D, R, I, V, E, R2.


STRENGTHS:
- Financial APP: The student describes a working actuarial reserve-analysis app that accepts triangle CSVs and produces concrete financial outputs (development factors, LDFs, IBNR, ultimate losses, reserves) and validated the outputs against industry expectations. The demonstrated Discover, Implement, and Validate stages provide specific, functional evidence that the tool performs the required financial tasks.
- Integrate AI: The submission shows clear, functional AI integration that adds value—automating data processing and generating human-readable explanations—and includes validation and user feedback. The student explains how AI is used in the pipeline and reflects on its role, meeting the criteria for effective integration.

criteria.criterion_name: Financial APP: The tool functions as a financial application.
evidence: "So my project solves that gap by creating an AI powered reserve analysis tool that lets anyone upload a CSV triangle and instantly get development factors, IBNR, total reserves, charts, and an AI generated summary."

"step one is upload this CSV... so when I run AI analysis the model calculates age to age factors cumulative LDFs uh projected ultimate losses, IBNR by year, total reserve estimate, and then the AI creates plain English uh effective summary..."

"To validate the tool, I checked three things. Does this model produce reasonable chain ladder results? Yes, I compare the development factors to typical industry ranges, and they're stable and consistent."
criteria.driver_alignment: Discover (defined an actuarial reserving problem and target users), Implement (described CSV upload and specific calculations/output produced), Validate (compared results to industry ranges and checked usability).
criteria.reasoning: The student describes a working actuarial reserve-analysis app that accepts triangle CSVs and produces concrete financial outputs (development factors, LDFs, IBNR, ultimate losses, reserves) and validated the outputs against industry expectations. The demonstrated Discover, Implement, and Validate stages provide specific, functional evidence that the tool performs the required financial tasks.

criteria.criterion_name: Integrate AI: The tool integrates AI capabilities effectively.
evidence: "So my project solves that gap by creating an AI powered reserve analysis tool that lets anyone upload a CSV triangle and instantly get development factors, IBNR, total reserves, charts, and an AI generated summary."
"I used Replet to build a front end... open AI for the natural language insights a simple chain ladder engine that processes the loss triangle and then a CSV upload..."

"when I run AI analysis the model calculates age to age factors cumulative LDFs uh projected ultimate losses, IBNR by year, total reserve estimate, and then the AI creates plain English uh effective summary and explains the results..."
criteria.driver_alignment:
- Discover: defined a clear user problem that AI addresses (automating repetitive triangle work and explaining results).
- Implement: described the system pipeline (CSV upload, chain-ladder engine, OpenAI for natural-language insights, "run AI analysis").
- Validate/Reflect: validated outputs against industry ranges and user feedback and reflected that AI automates the boring parts while leaving judgment to actuaries.
criteria.reasoning: The submission shows clear, functional AI integration that adds value—automating data processing and generating human-readable explanations—and includes validation and user feedback. The student explains how AI is used in the pipeline and reflects on its role, meeting the criteria for effective integration.
